name: Radisson Hotel Chicago O'Hare

reviews.text: Good Service at the small breakfast room, reasonable front office staff, clean & small rooms is what you can expect here. It is fairly close to the airport. About 5 mins ride. However, this is not the only hotel in the area and there is holiday inn, Four Points , Sheraton & a few other hotels in the area too.
reviews.title: Reasonable

reviews.text: There is nothing wrong but this seems like an older property with good housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: Very Surprised

reviews.text: Give it a shot if you are in the area.
reviews.title: not what I was expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on previous reviews,my expectations for this hotel were low.I was just going to need a room for 1 night , so, I would not need to be selective. But, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was nice and comfortable.I did not hear any noise in the room. It was quiet. The staff was very pleasant and courteous.The shuttle was prompt and efficient. The driver was friendly. It was a good value.I would stay here again.
reviews.title: A good 3-star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On route to the states from Ireland to avoid a long layover at chicago Ohare we decided to overnight here. I wanted an airport hotel with an outside pool and after checking reviews on tripadvisor felt confident in booking the raddisson. The shuttle arrived after a 15 to 20 min wait at shuttle stop 3. I had left my cardigan on the bus and he brought it in to me which was great as it was new. On booking through a third party I had requested an earlier check in than 3 pm as we were arriving at chicago at 1 after a long flight and when we checked in @ 2pm our room was ready. There is a luggage cart but no bellman and when the manager saw us struggling with our luggage he helped and got an employee to bring it to our room which was great as it was quite a hike from reception and we had a lot of heavy luggage. The room was comfortable 2 big beds , fridge, microwave, coffee maker no kettle but this is us standard. toiletries in bathroom, so no complaints whatsoever. After having something to eat we went to the pool which had plenty sunbeds and towels. We were tired after the journey, having been up early and the 6 hour time difference we went back to our room about 6pm made a few phone calls and at @6.45 pm went to bed. I always wear ear plugs when travelling and could hear a loud noise which apparently were planes taking off. I went to the window drew back the curtains to make sure the window was shut. I couldn't believe it, I had read the reviews and nobody mentioned the noise from the planes. I have stayed in a few airport hotels previously and because of soundproofing never heard anything maybe we were just unlucky where our room was. I couldn't go through having to change rooms and lugging luggage so I took one of my mothers sleeping tablets after an hour so I don't know how long this went on for. I asked for a wake up call which I got. Breakfast next morning was good with hot and cold choices. Before checking out I rang reception to see if someone could help with the luggage and was told someone would be up to help and after waiting and nobody arriving I told my mum to stay in the room and I would check out and see if someone was going to help. I asked the receptionist who said he was alone and went on the walkie talkies to ask someone from housekeeping to assist. I asked when the next shuttle was due and was told 14 minutes, so sat in the lobby waiting, getting a bit agitated that we would miss our flight so I approached reception to ask them to ring the room when I saw the luggage trolley. panic over. The young man brought the luggage to the front of the hotel and with that the shuttle pulled up. Would I stay again? I would have said yes as I had a good feel about the hotel, but the noise from the planes would make me hesitate, I really cannot understand it as nobody else mentioned it so maybe it depends where your room is, with efforts to make my flight I forgot to mention it on check out and I wasn't asked if I enjoyed my stay and I wish they had a bellman, otherwise a convenient, comfortable hotel.
reviews.title: Long wait for shuttle bus
Had higher expectations
reviews.text: Radisson is usually known as a good hotel but that was not the case with this one. The location was very convenient, right next to O'Hare but the service was not. After a long week of business travel I did not appreciate being greeted with bad customer service. The staff at the front desk was not very helpful, gave no helpful information or even which elevator to take. Very simple things that even cheap cruddy hotels will help you with, they did not.
I have stayed here a couple of times before, but generally always when in transit from O'Hare.
reviews.title: Great Airport Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not necessarily say the reception staff are overly welcoming, however, I was having some problems positioning my bags right to be able to wheel them to my room, and one of the staff quickly offered to help - I did decline as once the bags are positioned right, its easy to pull them, but I truly appreciated the offer.
reviews.title: Great management and great employees
All good
reviews.text: There are actually 2 lift wells in the hotel, they tell you about the one by reception, but if in the back of the hotel, the ones at the end of the corridor make better sense, especially with bags, as you do not have to negotiate as many corners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Longhorn Steakhouse next to the hotel, and it is so convenient to pop in there. There is also a IHOP across the road, and a number of other food places, and Target.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for O'Hare and Chicago

reviews.text: I got a great rate via Hotwire ($62) so, proximity to airport, free shuttle 24 hours a day, free internet, friendly and helpful staff, good sized, clean room with mini fridge, microwave and tea/coffee maker, Target, IHop, Steak n Shake across the road and Longhorn steakhouse attached to the hotel..totally make up for the fact that it's not a new property...I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a very nice weekend in Chicago area and stayed at this place. The Front desk staff is very professional and makes you feel valued and special from your arrival. All employees are friendly and greets you as you walk through the Hotel alleys. The breakfast service is quick and nice. The menu is simple and yet varied and complete. The location is easy to access with a great shopping mall just across the street. We also enjoyed a great dinner at the Longhorn Steakhouse, which was very convenient as we were tired upon arrival on Friday evening after a 5-hour drive. Overall we had an excellent experience.
reviews.title: Exceptionally nice and friendly staff

reviews.text: The hotel was an older hotel rebranded, the rooms are dark and the bathrooms are oh so small, I was surprised that they did not have any larger rooms and that they were all the same size. The rooms though seem to have been updated, it was the size of the bathroom, which there is nothing much they can do with that. was way too small for me. I was extremely pleased with the front desk, Danny was a real trooper when he answered all of my questions, along with Ryan and Ray. They have all been trained very well on customer service. When I called back because I left something behind, Oliver was extremely polite, found the item and had it waiting for me at the front desk. The breakfast staff could use some help, I never knew you could order off a menu, that would have been nice to have been told. All in all, I did enjoy the stay.
reviews.title: Rooms Small but Service Exceeded All Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did the Park 'n Sleep package. The Radisson Hotel was close to the airport. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They made us feel welcome. The room was clean. Shuttle service was on time. It was good value for what we got.
reviews.title: Convenient location, friendly and customer service oriented staff

reviews.text: Basics are well done
reviews.title: The motivated staff make this place great

reviews.text: As soon as we got off the plane, we headed to the visitor information kiosk to book a hotel, and we chose Radisson. We then went to the arrival’s gate to await the shuttle that would take us to the hotel.
reviews.title: Not recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle was late; we called the helpdesk to make sure that we were waiting in the right designated area and they told us it would be there in 10 minutes. We waited an additional 45 minutes or so until the shuttle finally arrived.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE

reviews.text: When we got to the hotel, the rooms were not ready. According to the receptionists, we didn’t put in a request for an early check-in. Once again we had to wait 30 minutes for one room to be ready and additional 30 minutes or so for the other.
reviews.title: Close to O'Hare Airport

reviews.text: The only good thing about the hotel was its location. Target, Office Depot, and many restaurants were right across the street from the hotel--very convenient!
reviews.title: Not a bad stay

reviews.text: As soon as I walked into the hotel there were three people behind the counter that were probly no older than 21. As I walked up to the counter not one person asked of if they could help me, didnt state welcome to the hotel, no how are you doing today...NOTHING. I did wait then I had to say I was checking in. The gentelman asked for my credit card and ID. Still not saying anything to me, he started processing everything for my room. Next thing he hands me a card and says this is your room number. THATS ALL. I then noticed that his name tag stated Manager Trainee. I asked Sam if he were training for a manager and his response was Yeah? So then I said he needs to work on his customer service skills because he barley spke to me, didnt tell me `where or which way my room was and didnt offer to help me to it. Well Luckly and older gentelman that works there seen that I was no happy, he walked up asked of I needed help, (which he did carry my luggage to my room) asked me how my day was and stated he hopes that I have a great saty. The room was nice an clean and spacious. So I decide to get ready for my evening hop into the shower and the next thing I notice is the water was not drainging , so I had to rush to get out because it was building. The sink was also the same way. The next morning when I went to take a shower the water was still in the tub. I called up front was placed on hold ( wasnt asked, was TOLD to hold) 5 min. passed, I hang up call back and get another young person. At this point I asked for the GM and of course he doesnt work on Saturdays and all they can do is give me a VM. I did receive a call. All the GM did was say sorry and he is going to check into it and wil lcall me back Well I'm writing this because it been a 1 1/2 since then and have yet to receive a call back. I will never stay here again. 1st and last time ever.
reviews.title: Nothing special

description: The Radisson Hotel Chicago O'Hare has just completed a major renovation in July 2011. The in-room look-and-feel and amenities are comparable to a 4 or 5-star hotel in the area.Hotel is located across the street from restaurants, financial institutions and shopping.The lobby provides guests with a comfortable and quiet atmosphere and at the same time offers a functional and available business center. Free wi-fi internet access for hotel guest only.
